content: hackschnitzel1071 ALGO: Hi, do I get it right a pos single node needs >1000cfx (~170$) to get ~11% apr? The more stake the more rewards. With a pool rewards can be higher because of fees of the stakers?
author: hackschnitzel1071 ALGO

content: iriesam: Yes that is correct. A minimum of 1k cfx to stake and the apr is around 11.3%. Each community pool varies slightly
author: iriesam

content: ?i??: average APR is 11.3%, but with only 1000CFX it's hard to get voting rights as the pos pool will be very tiny.
author: ?i??

content: Unknown: So, real APR will vary
author: Unknown

content: Estebanquito: is there some way to prune old blocks? I don't want to waste 1+TB of NVME just to store blocks that aren't needed if i can
author: Estebanquito

content: Unknown: Why are you using a backslash to bypass the link protection
author: Unknown

content: Unknown: the two responses are a scam
author: Unknown

content: Unknown: Another one?
author: Unknown

content: Ghost: @0xn1c0
author: Ghost

content: 0xn1c0: maybe you should use a light node instead if you are concerned about storage: https://doc.confluxnetwork.org/docs/general/run-a-node/node-types
author: 0xn1c0

content: Estebanquito: Light nodes cannot be used in PoS afaik
author: Estebanquito

content: Unknown: i want to run my PoS node but cannot waste 1+TB of nvme
author: Unknown

content: Unknown: Most chains have a prune function that allows you to delete old blocks and reduce disk usage, old blocks are wasted space for me
author: Unknown

content: Unknown: From the guide: A PoS node is also a Conflux node. So you can run a PoS node following the run a node guide. Either a full node or a archive node is fine.
author: Unknown

content: Unknown: no mention of light node
author: Unknown

content: ?i??: You can use btrfs + stdlib to have more space available
author: ?i??

content: ?i??: Check pinned messages on developers
author: ?i??

content: ?i??: developers?
author: ?i??

content: Estebanquito: Will try, ty for the info!
author: Estebanquito

content: Estebanquito: I hope some prune function is added anyways, as this works but doesn't work as space will grow overtime and become literal wasted space
author: Estebanquito

content: Estebanquito: still over a terabyte, will wait until something is done to get this down or just not run a node

content: mabi: Hello everyone, I am running a conflux node/server since last year all through linux/conflux-rust and would like to become a solo validator and stake all my CFX. I read the https://doc.confluxnetwork.org/docs/general/mine-stake/stake/become-a-solo-validator official documentation but this procedure is made for people using the fluent wallet which I am not. I am using my own conflux node to manage my wallets so I was wondering if there is a documentation available for people like me who would like to do everything through the conflux-rust CLI or using the RPC API via curl?
author: mabi

content: GLM ARBA: For now I can confirm the 'STAKE IN POW' step that references https://confluxhub.io/governance/pow-stake ...
author: GLM ARBA

content: GLM ARBA: This should be the technical docs for the 'POS REGISTER' step https://doc.confluxnetwork.org/docs/core/core-space-basics/internal-contracts/poSRegister
author: GLM ARBA

content: ?i??: @mabi I'm not 100% sure, but I remember reading something about software wallet that it was deprecated. Also havent used it myself. @0xn1c0 might know
author: ?i??

content: ?i??: Otherwise you can use the RPC API with conflux sdk
author: ?i??

content: ?i??: I'm not sure if there is direct documentation for RPC API available
author: ?i??

content: mabi: Hi @?i?? you mean the software wallet integrated into the conflux-rust node? My plan was anyway to use the RPC API simply using curl and passing it the right data but I miss the documentation for that...
author: mabi

content: xiaoxu1101: what's the benefit of being a node to help others stake coin?
author: xiaoxu1101

content: xiaoxu1101: could you please answer the question I have asked?
author: xiaoxu1101

content: Tan Elliott: When running a node, you can earn staking rewards, support the network’s decentralized security, and potentially have voting rights in governance.
author: Tan Elliott

content: GLM ARBA: A PoS pool can take a % of earned CFX, so it can be profitable
author: GLM ARBA

content: GLM ARBA: A PoS node just allows you the owner to stake
author: GLM ARBA

content: xiaoxu1101: got it, which means that if there's more nodes, that would be more decentralized right?
author: xiaoxu1101

content: GLM ARBA: absolutely. More nodes is a good thing
author: GLM ARBA
